amendment.description: Manager's amendment increases funding for the Consumer Product Safety Commission by $4.9 million bringing it to the authorized level of $118.2 million; provides an additional $250,000 for the National Credit Union Adminsistration's Community Development Revolving Loan Fund; and prohibits the use of funds for first-class travel for employees of agencies funded by the bill.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 1 printed in House Report 111-208 to (1) increase FY 2010 funding for the Consumer Product Safety Commission by $4,875,000 to the auth level of $118,200,000. FY 2010 funding under GSA Federal Buildings Fund will be reduced by the same amount; (2) transfer $250,000 from the GSA's Federal Building Fund operations account to the National Credit Union Administration's Community Development Revolving Loan Fund; and (3) prohibit the use of funds for first-class travel for employees of agencies funded by the bill, in contravention of Federal regulations.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Serrano amendment (A001) Agreed to by voice vote.
